Dispute_Type: Debt liability between trustee and financial institution
Legal_Issue: Whether Laurentian Trust is responsible for paying the debt owed to the Department of National Revenue from Marrazza's RRSP
Decision_Outcome: Laurentian Trust must pay the debt
Legal_Rule: An RRSP creates a creditor-debtor relationship governed by contract clauses; the trustee is considered the debtor
Grounds_for_Claim: Department of National Revenue's claim for unpaid debt from Marrazza's RRSP
Outcome_on_Merits: In favor of the Department of National Revenue
Key_Evidence_Considered: Contractual terms of RRSP, control of funds by Laurentian Trust
Legal_Framework: Contract law under Quebec civil law
Applicant_Challenge: Laurentian Trust's appeal of the payment order
Court_Result: Dismissal of appeal; original order upheld
Legal_Rule_Source: Quebec civil law and contractual provisions
Defendant_Response: Argued that the Bank, not the Trust, owes the debt
Remedy_Requested: Payment of outstanding debt from RRSP funds
Outcome: Laurentian Trust held liable and required to pay
Decision_Authority: Prothonotary Lafrenière, affirmed by appellate court
Remedy_Sought: Monetary payment to Department of National Revenue
Governing_Rule: Trustee (Laurentian Trust) is debtor under RRSP contract
